title: Discussion Simulation Course for Collaborative Argument-Based Learning (CABLE)

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic argumentative structures and experience with digital collaboration tools
context.additional_context: Real-time collaborative learning utilizing VR simulations in a BYOD environment

learning_goals: Learners can perform the role of Knowledge Integrator in structured argumentative discussions on controversial topics.
Learners can implement interaction patterns of a Discussion Facilitator (e.g., eliciting questions, organizing perspectives) with over 80% accuracy in three or more argumentative discussions.
Learners can analyze the correlation between individual argumentative contributions (Viewpoint Contributor) and group performance to design optimal participation strategies.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
